newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Aug industrial production down 1.0 pct.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Aug industrial production down 1.0 pct.

text.p: Malaysia's industrial production index for August fell by 1.0 percent from the preceding month, the national Bernama news agency reported on Monday.
Bernama's report did not immediately supply a year-on-year change for the industrial production index and Statistics Department officials could not be reached for comment.

Bank Negara Malaysia's quarterly bulletin gave the August 1995 industrial production index as 221.4. Based on Bernama's report on Monday that the August 1996 index was 238, the year-on-year change would be a 7.5 percent rise.
Bernama later confirmed a 7.5 percent year-on-year increase in the industrial production index for August.
The index for the first eight months of 1996 was up by 10.8 percent to 228.4 against the corresponding period last year, the agency quoted the Statistics Department as saying.
All three divisions computed for the industrial index -- manufacturing, electricity and mining -- recorded increases during the period.
The mining division rose by 5.9 percent, manufacturing 12.0 percent and electricity 12.4 percent.
The growth of the mining sector was due to higher output of crude oil and natural gas.
The electricity sector grew with a 12.4 percent increase in generation of electricity to 32,461 million kilowatt-hours.
